title: Enable SourceLink on MSBuild repo
body:
It would be super awesome to enable GitLink on the MSBuild repo if possible:
https://github.com/GitTools/GitLink

It would greatly simplify automatically downloading and opening the right MSBuild source file during debugging.

nodes.body: By now the feature request should be dotnet/sourcelink not gitlink, right @kirillosenkov?
You should probably update the issue. When i investigated the use of sourcelink for my employer, documentation and mentions were really quite all over the place.

This is supposed to be happening for us automatically via repo-toolset but I don't think it works. Unfortunately, I think the problems are all internal, so it'd be hard for someone outside Microsoft to fix it.

Wait, repo-toolset is supposed update the issue when the name and location of a requested feature is changed? For real?

EDIT: +1 for the label change. Up-For-Grab on an issue regarding deployment/publishing is quite weird, especially when the actual deployment doesn't seem to be happening in this repository.
No, repo-toolset is supposed to give us SourceLink in its default configuration.
Oh that. Yeah i think i saw SourceLink.CommandLine during restore in the build script.
